intro: Trigella, commonly known as the false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are annual or biennial herbs native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves and produce small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white. Trigella species are characterized by their fibrous roots and showy, showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. They are often found in disturbed soils and are used in some traditional medicinal practices.
